Rule.Name: Ensure ufw is installed (Automated)
Rule.NonCompliantComment: UFW is not installed, leaving the system without a basic firewall solution.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Install UFW to provide host-based firewall functionality.

Rule.Name: Ensure iptables-persistent is not installed with ufw (Automated)
Rule.NonCompliantComment: iptables-persistent is installed alongside UFW, which may create conflicting firewall rules.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Remove iptables-persistent when UFW is the chosen firewall utility.

Rule.Name: Ensure ufw service is enabled (Automated)
Rule.NonCompliantComment: The UFW service is not enabled or running; firewall rules may not be enforced.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Enable and start the UFW service.
Rule.Correction: systemctl enable ufw; systemctl start ufw
Rule.Verification: systemctl is-active ufw | grep -q '^active$' && echo 0 || echo 1

Rule.Name: Ensure ufw loopback traffic is configured (Automated)
Rule.NonCompliantComment: Loopback traffic is not explicitly allowed, potentially blocking local inter-process communication.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Allow all incoming and outgoing traffic on the loopback interface.
Rule.Correction: ufw allow in on lo comment 'allow loopback in'; ufw allow out on lo comment 'allow loopback out'
Rule.Verification: ufw status verbose | grep -q 'ALLOW.*LOOPBACK' && echo 0 || echo 1

Rule.Name: Ensure ufw outbound connections are configured (Manual)
Rule.NonCompliantComment: Outbound connection policy is not explicitly defined, which may block legitimate traffic.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Manually review business requirements and create outbound allow/deny rules accordingly.
Rule.Correction: echo "Manual configuration required: define UFW outbound rules"

Rule.Name: Ensure ufw firewall rules exist for all open ports (Automated)
Rule.NonCompliantComment: Some listening ports lack corresponding UFW rules, exposing services unintentionally.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Add UFW rules for every TCP/UDP port reported by ss -tuln (or netstat -tuln).
Rule.Correction: for p in $(ss -H -tuln | awk '{print $5}' | grep -oE '[0-9]+$' | sort -u); do ufw status numbered | grep -q ":.*ALLOW.*$p" || ufw allow "$p"; done
Rule.Verification: missing=$(ss -H -tuln | awk '{print $5}' | grep -oE '[0-9]+$' | sort -u | while read p; do ufw status numbered | grep -q ":.*ALLOW.*$p" || echo $p; done); [ -z "$missing" ] && echo 0 || echo 1

Rule.Name: Ensure ufw default deny firewall policy (Automated)
Rule.NonCompliantComment: The default incoming policy is not set to deny, exposing the system to unsolicited connections.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Set UFW default policies to deny incoming and allow outgoing traffic.
Rule.Correction: ufw default deny incoming; ufw default allow outgoing; ufw reload
Rule.Verification: ufw status | grep -q 'Default: deny (incoming)' && echo 0 || echo 1
